column5: Our outfitter was able to route us to a different lake that happened to be available. We are schedule to go back the lake we wanted last year and this year will be in a brand new cabin. They were able to build a new outpost on the same lake in a matter of weeks last fall. Our outfitter said it takes 26 flights of gear and men to build one of those.
I am bumming! Suppossed to be going to the shining tree area on June 9th but as of now I don't know if the trip is on or not. The Timmons fires has a 100 km perimiter that no one is allowed into.
Here is a link to Current Fire Situations in Ontario. Looks like Fire Season is starting strong.http://www.mnr.gov.on.ca/en/Business...ge/268862.html

That stinks. Hope you can get in. We were on North Gull while this video was being taken on South Gull. We have stayed at both North and South for years. We actually were flying out of North the same day this video was being taken on the 27th. Some of the video toward the middle and end is absolutely amazing.http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PZbNBXrq6qk
So does this mean no shore lunches near the Chapleau area? I leave Saturday morning and was looking forward to having shore lunches.

You can check on the fire ban status in your area....there is quite a bit of rain in the NW Ontario forecast, and Red Lake got about 1" of rain yesterday according to the Canadian weather website. You can still have shore lunch if there's a fire ban, just need to use a propane stove.

A 100 km perimeter! What's that? A 60 mile radius of what? Where can I find information out on this.? I'm positive this information is either incorrect or needs a whole lot of explanation. Where can I get this information. The link provided in post 2 doesn't say anything about no one let in anywhere. Please help with a source. Thankshttp://forest.lrc.gov.on.ca/AFFM/fir...maps/TIM09.pdf Restricted Timmins area.
Not sure about the 100 KM radiuss! From what?Hwy 101 from Timmins to Foleyet is closed and Hwy 144 S of Timmins is closed .!!Rick
It looks like 3 days of rain next week up there, that will change everything.Paul
Follow the links on the right Local Travel Restrictionshttp://www.mnr.gov.on.ca/en/Business...OD_087226.html
Last year our outpost burned down a few days before our trip. Not this s--- again! Maybe the natives can do a rain dance or something.
